channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: This housing market cycle is so unique that even Warren Buffett broke his own rules to make money on it

item.title: Quant who said passive era is ‘worse than Marxism’ doubles down
item.description: Inigo Fraser Jenkins calls it a “dystopian symbiosis”: a feedback loop between index funds and platform giants like Apple, Microsoft and Nvidia.

item.title: 5 Things You’re Doing Wrong in Your Self-Introduction
item.description: Your self-introduction is your words, from you, about you.

item.title: A Millennial-Favorite Lunch Trend Is Falling Out of Favor
The ‘Mad Men’ are dead! Long live the new advertising lions!
item.description: It’s been an unprecedented and brutal week for the advertising industry. The finalization of Omnicom Group’s $13 billion acquisition of Interpublic Gr...

item.title: How fit are you? 3 simple tests to evaluate your strength, endurance, and cardiovascular fitness
item.description: Most entrepreneurs are familiar with diminishing returns : how, when other variables stay constant, at some point putting in additional time and effor...

item.title: Empathy and reasoning aren’t rivals, research shows
item.description: For years, philosophers and psychologists have debated whether empathy helps or hinders the ways people decide how to help others. Critics of empathy ...

item.title: Netflix’s $5.8 billion breakup fee for Warner among largest ever
item.description: Inc.’s $72 billion acquisition of Inc. includes one of the biggest breakup fees of all time — a $5.8 billion penalty that Netflix has agreed to pay it...

item.title: How Meaning Supercharges Team Engagement and Profits
item.description: In the end, purpose isn’t soft, and profit isn’t cold.

item.title: How Clarity, Courage, and Fine-Tuned Feedback Create Unbreakable Companies
item.description: One day, you’ll look up and realize that your ‘crazy idea’ has become the business you always dreamed about.

item.title: Whatnot’s CEO on the rise of live shopping.

item.title: Olivia Nuzzi to leave Vanity Fair while denouncing ex-fiance Ryan Lizza’s Substack attack as ‘fiction-slash-revenge porn’

item.title: A Thanksgiving dealmaking sprint helped Netflix win Warner Bros.
item.description: While most Americans were feasting, Netflix executives and advisers hunkered down to finalize a binding offer and a $59 billion bridge loan.

item.title: ‘Its own research shows they encourage addiction’: Highest court in Mass. hears case about Instagram, Facebook effect on kids
item.description: The lawsuit claims Meta designed features to make them addictive and that its actions affected hundreds of thousands of Massachusetts teenagers.

item.title: You Can Now Read Jeffrey Epstein’s Emails in a Searchable Interface
item.description: The interface makes it easier to search through a monumental trove of documents. The site includes verification links to government originals.
